pullrequest.title: Use system URDF instead of our own

content.raw:
To the best of my knowledge, there are people pushing for URDF as well [1]

In the mean time, using the current sdformat in conjunction with ROS Hydro might result in pretty bad headaches. I am unsure about whether or not upgrading sdformat's URDF version will maintain API compatibility. The only thing I can say is that as a result of the current situation, ROS Hydro and Gazebo 1.9+ are not binary compatible.

[1]: http://mentors.debian.net/package/urdfdom
content.html:
To the best of my knowledge, there are people pushing for URDF as well 1

In the mean time, using the current sdformat in conjunction with ROS Hydro might result in pretty bad headaches. I am unsure about whether or not upgrading sdformat's URDF version will maintain API compatibility. The only thing I can say is that as a result of the current situation, ROS Hydro and Gazebo 1.9+ are not binary compatible.
